content:
Duvets and pillows must be OEKO-TEX Standard 100 certified and comply with OEKO-TEX requirements in General Requirements. The OEKO-TEX label can be either on care label or on separate label.

Duvets and pillows must comply with JYSK 4004 unless otherwise specified.

Duvets and pillows must comply with French degree EN 12952-1 requirements according to General Requirements.

Down and feather duvets and pillows must comply with EN 13186, and the recommended values in EN 12935 Annex A, Table A.

Duvet and pillow sizes must comply with the measurement list stated in Table 1.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
Edition 11 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Quality requirements must comply with Table 2.

| Requirement:      | Requirement:.1            | Tolerance:                                             | Test method:                                                                            |
|:------------------|:--------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

| Size              | Before washing            | +4/-0% nominal dimension                               | According EN 1167 (Duvets including fiber duvets must be measured according to EN 1167) |
| Size              | After washing and drying  | +4/-2% nominal dimension                               | According to ISO 3759 Flat made-up article                                              |
| Fiber composition | Fiber composition         | JYSK 4004                                              | AATCC 20A                                                                               |

content:
agreed specifications                     | BS 5335-1                                                                               |

Note: *Fill power must be measured according to EN 12130 (2018)

- 6.1 Method A: Steam conditioning.

- 3.2 Massic volume, Note 1 to entry; cubic inches (CUIN) per 30 grams.

Inner cushions with feather filling must comply with following requirements:

• Fabric, size and construction according to agreed specifications.

• Feather length must maximum be 5 cm measured from the top of the feather.

Pillows with foam must comply with JYSK 3002.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
General labelling for both duvets and pillows must comply with following:

• General labelling must comply with JYSK 6101.

• Care labels must comply with JYSK 6004.

Note: Care label must be taffeta or polyester satin according to agreement with CAM.

• The supplier must ensure that labels comply with Table 1.

• Labelling of down and feathers must comply with General requirements, EN 12130, EN 12131 and EN 12934.

JYSK will stop the use of corner labels on articles under the JYSK and KRONBORG brand by 31. August 2023. Articles shipped to JYSK after 1. September 2023 must be with flag labels. Exceptions must be approved by CAM.

Flag labels must be on both pillows and duvets. Flag labels must comply with requirements in Figure 1.

KRONBORG flag label is made available as JYSK 60013.

Scandinavian Sleeping & Living flag label is made available as JYSK 60018.

Note: The figure is not drawn to scale.

Page 5/16
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
KRONBORG (GOLD) flag label must be placed next to the care label and must comply with placement requirements in Figure 2.

The KRONBORG logo must only be on the flag label. The KRONBORG logo must be removed on the care label.

Additional labels e.g. a Danish flag must comply with 5.3.3.

Note: The figure is not drawn to scale.

Page 6/16
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
Scandinavian sleeping and living (PLUS) flag label must be placed next to the care label and must comply with placement requirements in Figure 3.

Additional labels e.g. a Danish flag must comply with 5.3.3.

Note: The figure is not drawn to scale.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:

content:
On BASIC articles there must not be added additional tags. Care label must comply with placement requirements in Figure 5.

Note: The figure is not drawn to scale.

Page 9/16
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
Edition 11 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Special rules apply to products for United Kingdom and Ireland.

UK and Ireland pillows must be Fire Retardant and labelled according to JYSK 4002.

Duvets must have a TOG rating informing the customer about its insulation ability.

The TOG rating must be tested according to BS 5335-1: 1991.

There can be exceptions where a size does not go to UK, contact CAM if in doubt.

On label it must be stated which size the duvet is including the TOG rating:

• Single – TOG (no.)

• Double – TOG (no.)

• King – TOG (no.)

• Super King – TOG (no.)

Duvets and pillows in bags must follow JYSK brand strategy:

• Special brand articles: CAM must approve special brand bags.

• Private label articles: The below guidelines must be followed regarding JYSK duvet bags.

• Max. Height 40 cm on duvet bag

• Max. Length 60 cm on duvet bag

• Bags must be with an insert at the end because the products are spaced with the end facing out on the shelves

• Width: Can be ordered in the size that fits the specific article (minimum 13,5 cm.)

Page 10/16
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
JYSK has brand strategy for private label duvets and pillows to be delivered in bags. These products must be delivered in a design provided by JYSK.

• All bags must be purchased by our designated bag supplier in China. Contact CAM for further information.

• Prices have been negotiated by JYSK, however they can deviate according to size.

• Pillows and duvets inserts must comply with ‘Pillows and Duvet Bag inserts’ requirements in JYSK 6201 and the following measurements:

• Height: 18.3 cm

• Width: 12 cm

There are three types of duvet bags:

Bag name: 15-ASQ-200

Bag name: 15-ASQ-201
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
Edition 11 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com

Bag name: 15-ASQ-202

There is one type: Fibre/Natural – GOLD

Bellybands for duvets must comply with below requirements:

• Layout must comply with JYSK 6201.

• Must be 21 cm in height and must comply with cardboard requirements in JYSK 6001.

• Must be closed with glue or double-sided adhesive tape and strengthened with a transparent round sticker. Note: The glue and tape must not adhere to the product itself.

• The tape must cover the entire closing edge from top to bottom and be ≥20 mm in width.

• The transparent sticker must be neatly placed (centered) on the bellyband closing edge.

• Must have an overlap ≥30 mm. The overlap must be adjusted from packaging to packaging.

• The placement of the bellyband must be centered lengthwise on the rolled duvet.

• The bellyband front must be placed opposite of the lose end of the rolled duvet.

Note: The diameter of the sales unit is given by the properties of the folded product.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
Stores shelf dimensions (EA dimensions) must be filled in by the supplier when filling in the supplier form. The stores shelf dimensions describe the measures of the product when it is placed in the stores see Table 3.

Three measures must be filled in:

• Width (cm)

• Length (cm)

• Height (cm)

The measures depend on whether the duvet/pillow is delivered in a bag/box or is folded lying freely on the shelves.

To determine the relevant height, depth, and width the pictures below can be helpful.

Store shelf dimensions will be measured in the following way see Example 9:

1. Stack 10 duvets on top of one another and measure the dimensions.

2. Divide the height number by 10 to determine the height dimensions of one duvet.

It is necessary to use the “pressed together” dimensions in order to determine how many duvets will fit on the shelf.

Duvets in bags are always spaced sideways with width facing front, see Example 10Error! Reference source not found..
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
EA dimension for pillows laying freely on the shelves must be measured in the following way see Example 11:

1. Stack 10 pillows on top of one another and measure the dimensions.

2. Divide the height number by 10 in order to determine the height dimension of one pillow.

It is necessary to use the 'pressed together' dimensions in order to determine how many pillows will fit on the shelf.

Pillows in bags are spaced sideways with width facing front, see Example 12Error! Reference source not found..

Pillows in boxes are spaced with the front towards the customers, see Example 13Error! Reference source not found..
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
WELLPUR accessories are spaced with the front towards the customers, see Example 14.

The supplier/agents must ensure that the sample’s quality match the specification, before sending reference or shipment samples.

If there is a deviation, the samples must not be sent to JYSK, and a new sample must be produced.

If there is a small deviation, which the supplier/agent consider minor, this should be commented and attached to the sample.

• Total weight / Net fill weight.

• GSM weight of the fabric.

• Thread count of the fabric using a microscope.

• Label inspection measures: Length, width and depth.

• Regular proof reading.

• Correct number of languages according to Table 1.

• Labelling must comply with JYSK 4004.

• Bag must comply with 7.

• Source tag according to 11 if needed.

• Make sure sample is labelled correct before sending to JYSK.

• Before sending sample, send an email advising the sample will be sent.

The source tag must comply with and Table 4 and JYSK 6003.

| Product type   | Placement of source tag                                                                                                  | Recommended label             |
|:---------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------|
| Duvet          | According to agreement with CAM: e Ina pocket-tag inside the duvet before it is filled and sewed « Inside the care label | 40x40 mm or 50x50 mm          |
| Pillow         |
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: In the care label or branding label according to agreement with CAM                                                      | 40x40 mm or 40 mm round label |
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
Duvet and pillows for children (baby and junior) must be produced and labelled according to EN 16779-1 and comply with following:

• No corner labels, loop labels, sharp edges, zippers, buttons or other loose parts etc. on the duvet.

• Labels must have a maximum length of 75 mm. Several labels of 75 mm in a bundle are allowed. The width must be 70 mm.

• Plastic- or rubber print on the duvet is not allowed.

• Stricter demands for threads, sewing and seams.

• Added flame-retardants are not allowed.

Duvets with a width of 120cm or less, and a length of 140cm or less must comply with EN 16779-1.

Each supplier must make sure to comply with the whole standard.

Duvets must have the below information and warnings on label in all the required languages:

• WARNING! Ensure the child’s face is uncovered

• WARNING! Keep away from fire

• Declaration of the thermal resistance TOG if available.

• (icon ”i”) ISO 7000 - 1641 must occur on the label.

• Care instructions (dry cleaning is not allowed).

Note: The warnings are available in JYSK Term database. Type “16779-1” in the Definition field and press enter.

Duvets must have a hangtag/booklet inside the packaging or fixed to the duvet.

The hangtag/booklet must contain
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content:
the following purchase information and user instruction in all the required languages:

• Must be headed; IMPORTANT KEEP FOR FUTURE REFERENCE

• WARNING! Ensure child’s face uncovered

• WARNING! Do not use in combination with sleep bag or blanket

• WARNING! Not recommended under 12 months (optional)

• WARNING! Keep away from fire

• STOP using cot duvet at the first sign of damages

• Follow the care instructions on the label. Be aware that dry cleaning is not allowed. Take into account the room temperature and the child's sleepwear. Overheating can endanger the life of your child! Baby duvets are recommended for cradles from 40x90 cm. Junior duvets are recommended for cots from 60x120 cm

Note: The warnings are available in JYSK Term database. Type “16779-1” in the Definition field and press enter.

• WARNING! Keep plastic covering away from children to avoid suffocation (icon or text)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 6 UK and Ireland products – Fire retardant and TOG
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Special rules apply to products for United Kingdom and Ireland.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 6.1 UK and Ireland pillows
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: UK and Ireland pillows must be Fire Retardant and labelled according to JYSK 4002.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 6.2 UK and Ireland duvets
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Duvets must have a TOG rating informing the customer about its insulation ability.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: The TOG rating must be tested according to BS 5335-1: 1991.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: There can be exceptions where a size does not go to UK, contact CAM if in doubt.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: On label it must be stated which size the duvet is including the TOG rating:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Single – TOG (no.)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Double – TOG (no.)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • King – TOG (no.)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Super King – TOG (no.)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: S3YSK| DUCK DOWN DUVET DOUBLE- TOG 10.5 FILLING POWER: 400 (EN12130) 200x220cm
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Example 2 - Example of a section of UK duvet care label with TOG rating
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 7 Duvet and pillow bags
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Duvets and pillows in bags must follow JYSK brand strategy:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Special brand articles: CAM must approve special brand bags.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Private label articles: The below guidelines must be followed regarding JYSK duvet bags.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Max. Height 40 cm on duvet bag
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Max. Length 60 cm on duvet bag
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Bags must be with an insert at the end because the products are spaced with the end facing out on the shelves
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Width: Can be ordered in the size that fits the specific article (minimum 13,5 cm.)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Edition 11 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 7.2 Private label bags (JYSK and KRONBORG)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: JYSK has brand strategy for private label duvets and pillows to be delivered in bags. These products must be delivered in a design provided by JYSK.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • All bags must be purchased by our designated bag supplier in China. Contact CAM for further information.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Prices have been negotiated by JYSK, however they can deviate according to size.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Pillows and duvets inserts must comply with ‘Pillows and Duvet Bag inserts’ requirements in JYSK 6201 and the following measurements:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Height: 18.3 cm
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Width: 12 cm

content: 8 Bellyband for duvets
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Bellybands for duvets must comply with below requirements:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Layout must comply with JYSK 6201.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Must be 21 cm in height and must comply with cardboard requirements in JYSK 6001.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Must be closed with glue or double-sided adhesive tape and strengthened with a transparent round sticker. Note: The glue and tape must not adhere to the product itself.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • The tape must cover the entire closing edge from top to bottom and be ≥20 mm in width.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • The transparent sticker must be neatly placed (centered) on the bellyband closing edge.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Must have an overlap ≥30 mm. The overlap must be adjusted from packaging to packaging.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • The placement of the bellyband must be centered lengthwise on the rolled duvet.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • The bellyband front must be placed opposite of the lose end of the rolled duvet.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Note: The diameter of the sales unit is given by the properties of the folded product.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Example 8 - Example of duvet with bellyband
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Edition 11 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 9 Store shelves dimensions
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Stores shelf dimensions (EA dimensions) must be filled in by the supplier when filling in the supplier form. The stores shelf dimensions describe the measures of the product when it is placed in the stores see Table 3.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Three measures must be filled in:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Stores shelf dimensions @ 8 Width -cm Oo @ Length - cm Oo @ = Height - cm ®@ Volumen - M? oO
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Table 3 - Supplier form
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: The measures depend on whether the duvet/pillow is delivered in a bag/box or is folded lying freely on the shelves.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: To determine the relevant height, depth, and width the pictures below can be helpful.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Store shelf dimensions will be measured in the following way see Example 9:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 1. Stack 10 duvets on top of one another and measure the dimensions.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 2. Divide the height number by 10 to determine the height dimensions of one duvet.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: It is necessary to use the “pressed together” dimensions in order to determine how many duvets will fit on the shelf.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Height 4 %, ss %s ve oe
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 1. Stack 10 pillows on top of one another and measure the dimensions.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 2. Divide the height number by 10 in order to determine the height dimension of one pillow.

content: 10 Reference and shipment samples – Supplier procedure
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: The supplier/agents must ensure that the sample’s quality match the specification, before sending reference or shipment samples.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: If there is a deviation, the samples must not be sent to JYSK, and a new sample must be produced.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: If there is a small deviation, which the supplier/agent consider minor, this should be commented and attached to the sample.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Total weight / Net fill weight.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • GSM weight of the fabric.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Thread count of the fabric using a microscope.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Label inspection measures: Length, width and depth.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Regular proof reading.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Correct number of languages according to Table 1.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Labelling must comply with JYSK 4004.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Bag must comply with 7.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Source tag according to 11 if needed.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Make sure sample is labelled correct before sending to JYSK.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Before sending sample, send an email advising the sample will be sent.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 11 Source tagging for Duvets and Pillows
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: The source tag must comply with and Table 4 and JYSK 6003.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Product type Placement of source tag Recommended label According to agreement with CAM: Duvet • In a pocket-tag inside the duvet before it is filled and sewed 40x40 mm or 50x50 mm • Inside the care label Pillow In the care label or branding label according to agreement with CAM 40x40 mm or 40 mm round label
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Table 4 – Source tagging
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Edition 11 – 2025-05 Compliancequality@JYSK.com
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 12 Duvets and pillows for children
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Duvet and pillows for children (baby and junior) must be produced and labelled according to EN 16779-1 and comply with following:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • No corner labels, loop labels, sharp edges, zippers, buttons or other loose parts etc. on the duvet.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Labels must have a maximum length of 75 mm. Several labels of 75 mm in a bundle are allowed. The width must be 70 mm.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Plastic- or rubber print on the duvet is not allowed.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Stricter demands for threads, sewing and seams.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Added flame-retardants are not allowed.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 12.1 Safety requirements and test methods for children's cot duvets
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Duvets with a width of 120cm or less, and a length of 140cm or less must comply with EN 16779-1.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Each supplier must make sure to comply with the whole standard.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 12.2 Labelling on children’s duvets
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Duvets must have the below information and warnings on label in all the required languages:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Ensure the child’s face is uncovered
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Keep away from fire
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Declaration of the thermal resistance TOG if available.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • (icon ”i”) ISO 7000 - 1641 must occur on the label.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Care instructions (dry cleaning is not allowed).
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Note: The warnings are available in JYSK Term database. Type “16779-1” in the Definition field and press enter.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Duvets must have a hangtag/booklet inside the packaging or fixed to the duvet.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: The hangtag/booklet must contain the following purchase information and user instruction in all the required languages:
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Must be headed; IMPORTANT KEEP FOR FUTURE REFERENCE
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Ensure child’s face uncovered
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Do not use in combination with sleep bag or blanket
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Not recommended under 12 months (optional)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Keep away from fire
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • STOP using cot duvet at the first sign of damages
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • Follow the care instructions on the label. Be aware that dry cleaning is not allowed. Take into account the room temperature and the child's sleepwear. Overheating can endanger the life of your child! Baby duvets are recommended for cradles from 40x90 cm. Junior duvets are recommended for cots from 60x120 cm
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: Note: The warnings are available in JYSK Term database. Type “16779-1” in the Definition field and press enter.
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: 12.3 Plastic packaging (all)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf

content: • WARNING! Keep plastic covering away from children to avoid suffocation (icon or text)
source: JYSK 1008 - Category Standard - Duvets and pillows.pdf
